abstract: Profile of renowned horse trainer Larry Jones, who is preparing to saddle two prime contenders at the 141st Kentucky Oaks; Jones, one of few trainers who actually rides horses every morning, has returned to top of his sport only one year after near-fatal riding accident.
lead_paragraph: Larry Jones, who has two prime contenders in Friday’s Kentucky Oaks, is renowned for his ability to develop fillies. Last April, though, he was seriously injured when a 2-year-old tossed him.

headline.main: Recovered From a Fall That Nearly Killed Him, a Trainer Gets Back to Winning
headline.print_headline: Recovered From a Fall That Nearly Killed Him, a Trainer Gets Back to Winning
